page.title: 16TRANSPORT IN STOW
page.content: {Pulham and Sons}of Bourton provide a bus service from Stow north to {Moreton.}Most buses go to{Cheltenham through{Bourton}though a few go through{Lower Swell.}One bus a week was provided to get to{Cirencester after local government reorganisation placed the District Council's offices there. Moreton is the local{rail-head}after the local station (2 miles away!) was closed under the Beeching plan in 1962. From Moreton{London}is little more than 90 minutes away. Inevitably most people are obliged to have a{car}of some sort with a surprising number of families having two or even three vehicles. The principal road through the block is the A429, the Roman Fosse Way, a busy holiday route from the Midlands to the South and South-west.
